sentences.en: Many Chinese, who disapprove of its sexual movements, consider it unruly and licentious.
sentences.cn: 许多中国人对舞蹈中性意味强烈的动作表示不满, 认为太过狂野和放荡.

sentences.en: Many will follow their licentious and because of them the way of truth will be reviled.
sentences.cn: 有许多人将要随从他们的放荡,甚至真理之道,也要因他们而受到诽谤.

sentences.en: Saint Augustine, as you know before he became a Christian, had quite a kind of licentious life, sexually, and lived with women and … that kind of thing.
sentences.cn: 我们都知道圣奥古斯丁在信主前过着一种性生活非常放纵的生活，诸如和很多女人同居之类。

sentences.en: She felt a bit comfortlessness to his licentious behavior.
sentences.cn: 她对他放肆的行为感到有点不舒服。

sentences.en: She felt a little upset about her licentious behavior.
sentences.cn: 她对他放肆的行为感到有点不舒服。

sentences.en: She felt uncomfortable for his licentious act.
sentences.cn: 她对他放肆的行为感到有点不舒服。

sentences.en: This kind of freedom is licentious.
Though great artists have been licentious, licence does not necessarily result in great art.
sentences.cn: 伟大的艺术家们虽然曾经都是放荡形骸的, 但放荡形骸未必导致伟大的艺术.

trans.tran_cn: 放荡的，淫乱的，猖狂自恣，猖，荒淫
trans.tran_en: behaving in a sexually immoral or uncontrolled way
